Package ohos.bundle

Class LauncherService

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.bundle.LauncherService

  • public class LauncherService
extends Object
    Queries launcher ability and application information for vehicles.

    You can use this class to register a callback method for observing bundle status changes.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  LauncherService.BundleStatusCallback
      Provides callback methods that are called after a bundle is installed, uninstalled, or updated.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      LauncherService​(Context context)
      A constructor used to create a LauncherService instance.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Obtains a launcher ability based on the ElementName and userId specified in the given Intent.
      Optional<List<LauncherAbilityInfo>> getAbilityList​(String bundleName, int userId)
      Obtains launcher abilities based on the Intent that contains Intent.ACTION_HOME and Intent.ENTITY_HOME.
      Optional<ApplicationInfo> getApplicationInfo​(String bundleName, int flags, int userId)
      Obtains information about an application based on the given bundle name, flag, and user ID.
      Optional<List<LauncherShortcutInfo>> getShortcutInfos​(String bundleName)
      Obtains information about the shortcuts of the application.

      Checks whether an ability exists and is enabled.

      Checks whether a bundle exists and is enabled.

      Registers a callback method for monitoring bundle installation, uninstallation, and update events.

      Starts a shortcut based on the given shortcut ID and bundle name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LauncherService

        public LauncherService​(Context context)
        A constructor used to create a LauncherService instance.

        You can use this instance to register callback methods for monitoring bundle installation, uninstallation, and update events.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the Context object of the current ability.
        Since:
        1

    • Method Detail

      • registerCallback

        public void registerCallback​(LauncherService.BundleStatusCallback callback)
        Registers a callback method for monitoring bundle installation, uninstallation, and update events.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.LISTEN_BUNDLE_CHANGE permission from the system. The ohos.permission.LISTEN_BUNDLE_CHANGE permission is of the signature|privileged level.

        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback method to be called.
        Since:
        1

      • unRegisterCallback

        public void unRegisterCallback​()
        Unregisters the callback method for monitoring bundle installation, uninstallation, and update events.
        Since:
        1

      • getAbilityList

        public Optional<List<LauncherAbilityInfo>> getAbilityList​(String bundleName,
                                                          int userId)
        Obtains launcher abilities based on the Intent that contains Intent.ACTION_HOME and Intent.ENTITY_HOME.

        If a bundle name is specified, information about launcher abilities matching the specified bundle is returned. Otherwise, information about all launcher abilities that match the Intent is returned.

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name.
        userId - Indicates the user ID.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of LauncherAbilityInfo objects.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Intent.ACTION_HOME, Intent.ENTITY_HOME

      • getAbilityInfo

        public Optional<LauncherAbilityInfo> getAbilityInfo​(Intent intent,
                                                    int userId)
        Obtains a launcher ability based on the ElementName and userId specified in the given Intent.
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the Intent containing the application bundle name to be queried.
        userId - Indicates the user ID.
        Returns:
        Returns a LauncherAbilityInfo object.
        Since:
        1

      • getApplicationInfo

        public Optional<ApplicationInfo> getApplicationInfo​(String bundleName,
                                                    int flags,
                                                    int userId)
        Obtains information about an application based on the given bundle name, flag, and user ID.
        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name to be queried.
        flags - Indicates the flag used to specify information contained in the ApplicationInfo objects that will be returned.
        userId - Indicates the user ID.
        Returns:
        Returns an ApplicationInfo object.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        IBundleManager.GET_APPLICATION_INFO_WITH_PERMISSION, IBundleManager.GET_BUNDLE_DEFAULT

      • isBundleEnabled

        public boolean isBundleEnabled​(String bundleName)
        Checks whether a bundle exists and is enabled.
        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the bundle is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • isAbilityEnabled

        public boolean isAbilityEnabled​(AbilityInfo abilityInfo)
        Checks whether an ability exists and is enabled.
        Parameters:
        abilityInfo - Indicates information about the ability to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the ability exists and is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getShortcutInfos

        public Optional<List<LauncherShortcutInfo>> getShortcutInfos​(String bundleName)
        Obtains information about the shortcuts of the application.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.MANAGE_SHORTCUTS permission from the system. The ohos.permission.MANAGE_SHORTCUTS permission is of the signature level.

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the application.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of LauncherShortcutInfo objects containing shortcut information about the application.
        Since:
        3

      • startShortcut

        public void startShortcut​(String shortcutId,
                          String bundleName)
        Starts a shortcut based on the given shortcut ID and bundle name.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.MANAGE_SHORTCUTS permission from the system. The ohos.permission.MANAGE_SHORTCUTS permission is of the signature level.

        Parameters:
        shortcutId - Indicates the ID of the shortcut to start.
        bundleName - BundleName Indicates the bundle name of the application to which the shortcut belongs.
        Since:
        3
